content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 9 to node 2 is:


```arduino
9 -> 12 -> 7 -> 4
```
The shortest path was found by following the edges in the specified order. Please note that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point. Therefore, changing node 2 to node 7 would give you the same path, but it would start with "9 -> 12 -> 7".

The shortest path from node 9 to node 12 is:


```arduino
9 -> 12
```
The shortest path was found by following the edges in the specified order. Please note that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point. Therefore, changing node 12 to node 7 would give you the same path, but it would start with "9 -> 12 -> 7".
